page.title: 06 LOCAL HISTORY PART 2
page.content: The Vicarage well is deeper by a futher fifty feet. Keep's Well at Shiplake Rise, contained in a domed roundhouse of grey brick, is possibly the one constructed in 1724 by Colonel William Boyle of Holmwood to replace the pond at Little Green adjoining Nathan Jemmatt's farm which had until then supplied that locality with water. From the local newspaper, the Henley Standard, on the 29th of August 1980 came the following report - " A familiar landmark at Shiplake Rise was destroyed on Friday when a tractor trailer struck Keep's Well beside the Shiplake-Binfield Heath road. The domed roundhouse built of grey brick over one hundred years ago was reduced to a pile of rubble. Only a month ago, because the parish council was concerned about motorists
